solution.text:
volume of pen stand = volume of the cuboid - volume of the 3 cones
volume of the cuboid=\(l\times b \times h\), where \(l\) is length, \(b\) is width and \(h\) is height
\(\Rightarrow \) Volume of the cuboid\(=_{{2*k}}_ \times _{{4*k}}_ \times _{k}_=_{{8*k*k*k}}_\)
Now volume of the cone\(=\frac 13 \times[\pi \times r^2 \times height]\) radius, R of the cone=\(_{{Decimal('0.5')*k}}_\) and height \(= _{k}_ \)
\(\Rightarrow \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{{Decimal('0.5')*k}}_^2 \times _{k}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_\)
Volume of the 3 cones=\(3\times _{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_=_{{trunc(3*pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_\)
Volume of the wooden pen stand\(=_{{8*k*k*k}}_ -_{{trunc(3*pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(8*k*k*k-3*pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_\,cm^3\)
Now we know \(mass=Density \times volume=_{j}_\times _{{trunc(8*k*k*k-3*pi_val*k*k*k/12,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(j*(8*k*k*k-3*pi_val*k*k*k/12),2)}}_\, g \)

content.text:
Find the mass of the wooden pen stand having 3 conical depressions of height equal to the height of the cuboid
Dimensions of the cuboid: length= _{{4*k}}_cm, height= _{k}_cm and width= _{{2*k}}_cm
Density of the wood is _{j}_g per \(cm^3\)and value of R is \(_{{Decimal('0.5')*k}}_\, cm\)
